Description: 45 beads in different shapes and materials. A: Three ring-beads, made of glass, in slightly different sizes, for one of them half is broken off. All corroded and pearlescent in colour. B: One roughly ring-shaped bead, slightly irregular at one side, resulting in a pear-shaped appearance. Made of white faience. C: One cylindrical bead, broken off at one end, made of white faience. D: Two ring-shaped beads, made of white faience, one of them slightly irregular. E: 19 disc-shaped beads in slightly different sizes. 17 made of faience, 16 of them white, one in light green, 2 made of ostrich eggshell. F: 20 segmented cylindrical beads, most of them broken at both ends, one of them preserved in a larger size. All made of white faience.
Acquisition notes: Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
